titleStmt.title: as I couldn't and cant rest
a machine readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Walt Whitman

address.addrLine: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. The text encoding and editorial notes were created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Any reuse of the material should credit the Walt Whitman Archive. Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

notesStmt.note: As this manuscript mentions Passage to India, it was written after the publication of that volume in 1870. It is possible that, as Edward F. Grier has suggested, this is a draft of material intended for a preface to Two Rivulets, which was published in 1876.
The following are responsible for particular readings or for changes to this file, as noted: Janel Cayer Brett Barney Vanessa Steinroetter Ashley Lawson

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: as I couldn't and cant rest
bibl.orgName: Walt Whitman Collection, The Bancroft Library, University of California, Berkeley
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

body.p:
— as I couldn't and cantcan't rest,
since during & since
the war without chanting Nationality, The Union, all These States
— ending with
—and
—and
the pieces still rounding my songs with keeping
"Passage to India," for my
concluding songs.
then my climax and close.
. . . . And now my whole Poemems, such as they
are
, I give to identify in essentially our time, the same old Themes, of all poems, only in Modern and Democratic Forms, the Nineteenth Century, with all its special features
—the Our —These
States—the Man
or and
Woman in them—the War of 1861–'65——Keeping Passage to India for climax and close of all.
